executiveSummary: Bill Shuan and Kyle Bird, recent college graduates, pitched their startup Amber on Shark Tank, seeking $200,000 for 20% equity. Amber offers a biometric-secured public phone charging station for venues. The sharks unanimously rejected the proposal due to high costs, lack of traction, technical flaws, and impractical market positioning.
nextSteps: The founders may need to revisit product design, lower production costs, and refine the business model before pursuing further investment opportunities.
